text: i have set only desktop but i need change some style in mobile view
Thanks for confirming. We do currently have a beta running that allows developers to set padding on the mobile version of the page. Would you be interested in joining the beta?
I have some More Queries about husbpot boilerplate Theme If you can Help me

1:- How to add custom class in DND_SECTION, DND_COLUMN and Dnd_row
2:-How i can re-order in DND column in Mobile View
3:-how i changes spacing in mobile version boilerplate theme
4:-How to adjust pending in mobile responsive:
5:-Can be use before,after in boilerplate
6:-how to add custom form

I have a dnd template that is supposed to be using two columns side by side one is width=4 and the other width = 8 but they show up as 50% instead.  And now that the actual page is created using that template I am unable to actually drag those column sizes.  Nor can I drag column sizes when I create a new section on that page.  Any ideas?
Do you have any CSS on the page that might conflict with the grid classes?
I don’t but I just threw in the boiler plate _layout.css and that seems to help matters.
Great! I’ll add you to the mobile beta. That would cover items 3 and 4 above.
For the 1st item above, we aren’t currently allowing custom classes to be added to sections, columns or rows, but we’re working on solving for that use case in a few different ways in the future
Item 2 also currently isn’t possible, but is something we’re exploring as a v2 of the mobile beta.

Hello everyone!

I created a classic theme with html, css, modules and such. I would like to use the drag and drop capabilities inside my templates without losing the semantic html (main/section/article/etc.) but I can't find a way.
All I get is a bunch of divs with classes and I lose all my markup.
Is there a way to achieve this?

Thanks!
